Sentiment Detail: - **Strong track record**: Sussex County has consistently approved multiple solar farm projects over the years, including recent approvals for four solar fields in 2024 and numerous community solar initiatives. - **Supportive regulations**: The county adopted specific ordinances (like No. 2920 in 2023) to establish clear guidelines for solar farms, showing institutional support for renewable energy. - **Active development**: Multiple large-scale projects are underway or completed, including the Bruce A. Henry Solar Farm expansion and several community solar projects by companies like TurningPoint Energy and Nautilus Solar.

- **Strong regulatory support**: New Castle County has actively loosened solar restrictions and implemented ordinances requiring new commercial buildings to be solar-ready, showing clear commitment to renewable energy development. - **Multiple successful projects**: Several large-scale solar projects are under development or completed, including community solar initiatives by TurningPoint Energy and Nexamp totaling 9MW. - **Proactive planning**: The county has expanded zones where solar installations are permitted beyond industrial areas to include suburban and agricultural zones, demonstrating forward-thinking policy for renewable energy growth.

- **Recent approvals with opposition**: Kent County has approved several solar projects but faces consistent legal challenges and community opposition, particularly from groups like Citizens Against Solar Pollution. - **Regulatory evolution**: The county has implemented both supportive measures (community solar guidelines) and restrictive ones (moratoriums on utility-scale projects), showing a cautious approach to energy development. - **Active development despite challenges**: Multiple projects are moving forward (like Chaberton Energy's developments) while others face significant hurdles, indicating a complex regulatory and social environment.
Recent Projects: Chaberton Energy, Pivot Energy (10/29/2024): Two community solar projects in Kent County, Delaware totaling nearly 10 MWdc - Crestone and Blackburn Solar Farms - will provide clean energy to approximately 900 households with 10% average electricity cost savings; Link: https://www.pivotenergy.net/newsroom/two-kent-county-del.-community-solar-projects-among-first-to-break-ground-in-state; Chaberton Energy (10/28/2024): Groundbreaking of Crestone Solar Farm project that will generate enough electricity for over 500 homes in Delaware; Link: https://www.chaberton.com/crestone-breaks-ground/; Chaberton Energy (10/28/2024): Blackburn Solar Farm project initiated to power more than 400 homes, part of Delaware's community solar initiatives; Link: https://www.chaberton.com/crestone-breaks-ground
